result.execSummary:
The defendant John P Vang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>50g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random screenings.

No contact with family memebers left up to PO.

No contact with any known drug users/dealers.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

State's Response brief to def's Motion for severance
State's Brief in support of joinder of def's

2:54 PM - Def in court w/Atty Theodore J. Skemp.  John William Kellis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Crt: this was set in response to a JSS violation of   7/7/16. The hx reported was diluted UA... SKEMP: I can't speak to the diluted. He's had 2. He wasn't even aware of the first violation. He wasn't intending to dilute. The missed UA, he had met w/ me and forgot he had to contact them. Positive UA - to be frank, he and I talked about his current situation and he was distressed by that and resorted to his old ways. He assures me that it's not an issue. I explained that the court  can put him back in jail but he's putting in jeopardy a large cash bond that was posted by friends and family. He's asking for another chance. He had 7 mos of fairly good behavior. He's willing to test daily. KELLIS: for the majority of this case he has been bond requirement. He had a relapse. I wish he would have admitted that at the time. But leave to the court. CRT: I want to be clear - I won't stand by and watch bond violations. Serious offenses. Potential for a length period of incarceration. When I get a JSS report I have 3 options....  Another report showing missed or diluted unless they are minors or strong mitigating factors, I woudn't have a problem issuing an OTD. Bond to remain.

Hearing on Pre-Trial Motions: 09-13-16 - All Morning.
Jury trial on October 25, 2016 at 08:45 am.
Prelim Hrg held 10-29-15 w/ SLH - filed by Michelle Stello

2:32 PM - Def in court w/Atty Theodore J. Skemp.  Emily Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Betthauser  - atty f/ co def
Crt: court established deadlines to ensure mtns  handled in a timely fashion and that these could proceed to trial as scheduled. Atty Skemp filed a mtn to extend as discovery hasn't been completed and I wanted a hearing. SKEMP: I filed the mtn as we were going thru the discover we have. We have been given over 100 photos but we can't really see them due to the quality. As to my client, those are charges back to  2012 and the CI's were wired and we don't have the audio from those buys yet. There are almost 30k pgs of info on FB and  500+ calls from jail. Just going thru those is a huge amt of time. I talked to DDA Barton and Atty Betthauser and I think the trial date set is overly optomistic. BETTHAUSER: I filed a speedy trial and w/drew that. I have 28gigs on a flash drive. It's a lot to get thru even in the mos we had this case. I would feel more comfortable if all parties had more time to prepare an adequate defense to our clients. HYNEK; we don't object to the con't of the trial. We are aware of the amt of volume of info but ask that they remain together.  CRT: I think I should set a hearing where all 3 are present. The allegation of Yia is that he was involved w/ his bros over a several yr period. will GRANT  the request to extend the deadlines.  If Betthauser is filing a mtn to sever it has to be done by 3/4. 
CRT: On 3/11 at 9 we will only take up the matter of the trial date and then set add'l deadlines at the same time. 
SEND NEW NOH ON ALL 3 CASES - 15CF701 AND 15CF700 and this one noting the change
for Extension of time to file Pretrial Motions
